publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2789 Robin Harper: Protection of Scottish Coral Reefs—That the Parliament notes with concern the recent research from the Marine Biological Station on Cumbrae, published by the Royal Society, which shows that large and diverse coral reefs off the north-west of Scotland which are more than 4,500 years old and the habitat of diverse and unique marine species are suffering wide-scale fishing damage and requests that the Scottish Executive and Her Majesty’s Government take urgent action to protect the "Darwin Mounds" and other environmentally significant areas of deep-sea coral, including designating them as marine Special Areas of Conservation.
S1M-2789 Protection of Scottish Coral Reefs (lodged on 26 February 2002) Alex Neil*

S1M-2789 Robin Harper: Protection of Scottish Coral Reefs-That the Parliament notes with concern the recent research from the Marine Biological Station on Cumbrae, published by the Royal Society, which shows that large and diverse coral reefs off the north-west of Scotland which are more than 4,500 years old and the habitat of diverse and unique marine species are suffering wide-scale fishing damage and requests that the Scottish Executive and Her Majesty's Government take urgent action to protect the "Darwin Mounds" and other environmentally significant areas of deep-sea coral, including designating them as marine Special Areas of Conservation. Supported by: Alex Neil
S1M-2789 Protection of Scottish Coral Reefs (lodged on 26 February 2002) Mr Andrew Welsh*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2789 Protection of Scottish Coral Reefs (lodged on 26 February 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2789 Protection of Scottish Coral Reefs (lodged on 26 February 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
